If children ruled the world, they might prioritize fun and play over work and responsibilities, leading to a lack of productivity and structure in society.
Children might make decisions based on their emotions rather than logic, leading to impulsive and irrational policies.
Children might not have the same level of life experience and knowledge as adults, leading to a lack of understanding and empathy in decision-making.
Children might not be able to handle the responsibility and pressure of ruling a nation, leading to conflicts and power struggles.
Children might not have the same level of discipline and focus as adults, leading to a lack of commitment and follow-through in decision-making.
